main.slogan: The power of simplicity in the Internet of the Things
main.how_to_get_account_link: How do I get an account?
main.how_to_get_account_p1: Thank you so much for your interest in pvCloud platform.
main.how_to_get_account_p2: pvCloud is now in "BETA" mode; this is, at this moment we are validating the product brefore officially launching it to mainstream.
main.how_to_get_account_p3: At this moment pvCloud accounts are being opened through invitation from actual users / beta-testers.
main.how_to_get_account_p4: If any of your friends has an account ask them to invite you! :-)

_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.title: How to use pvCloud in your App/Devices
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.intro_p1: In this document you'll find (custom) information for your IoT App.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.intro_p2: The following three sections describe how to utilize pvCloud for uploading and consuming data through your IoT Application.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.intro_p3: Click on the title of the section you'd like to explore, to expand it and read its content.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.section1_desc_p1: This section describes 3  basic steps to implement pvCloud in your IoT App for Intel Edison, Intel Galileo or similar Linux/NodeJS compatible devices.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.section1_step1_p1: Run the following 'wget' command in your Edison's LINUX terminal. This will download the program pvcloud_api.js which is coded to communicate your device to this particular application.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.section1_step1_a1_title: You can also download it to your PC
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.section1_step2_p1: If you have not already done so, run the following commands in the LINUX terminal of your Edison to install the nodejs module 'request.js'.
_mycloud_myapps_edit_dd.section1_step3_p1: The following commands exemplify the operations available in pvCloud driver (write, read, readlist, delete).
